case_title: MUHAMMAD ALI vs MANZOOR AHMAD AND Other
reference_no_or_id: Criminal Appeal No. 21 of 1977, Criminal Appeal No. 580 of 1974

accussed_details.name: Manzoor Ahmad
allegation: Fired a shot causing injury to Ghulam Rasul

accussed_details.name: Fateh Ali
allegation: Caused deaths of Muhammad Anwar and Hakam Ali

complaint_summary: Dispute over water turn led to a sudden fight involving firearms and sharp-edged weapons, resulting in deaths and injuries.
investigation_summary: Police recovered blood-stained spear and revolver with live bullets. Injuries and deaths were documented. FIR lodged after delay.
judgment_summary: The Supreme Court reviewed evidence and concluded the fight was sudden without premeditation. Convictions were adjusted based on established facts.

Manzoor Ahmad.sentence: 3 years R.I., Rs. 2,000 fine as compensation to Ghulam Rasul, 6 months R.I. in default

sentence: 10 years R.I., Rs. 5,000 fine as compensation to heirs of Anwar
3 years R.I., Rs. 2,000 fine as compensation to Muhammad Ali and Ghulam Rasul (each count), 6 months R.I. in default

legal_arguments: High Court erred in discarding corroborated evidence.
Close blood relationship excludes false implication.

witness_statement.Muhammad Ali: Described altercation and fight over water turn.

key_issues: Deaths and injuries caused by firearms and sharp-edged weapons.

maxims.Undue Advantage: Defined as taking excessive benefit during sudden fight.
maxims.Cruel Manner: Evaluated based on circumstances of weapon use.

legal_terms.Section 308 PPC: Punishment for injuries caused during sudden fight.

summary_vector_notes: Sudden fight over water turn led to deaths and injuries. Supreme Court reviewed evidence, adjusted convictions, and imposed sentences under relevant PPC sections.

facts.altercation: Led to a fight involving firearms and sharp-edged weapons
